experience.title: Blizzard Entertainment
experience.description: I maintained existing codebase and implemented new features in the Battle.net Account Management system, including work to migrate the current codebase from Spring 3 to Spring 4 and Java 8.  I constantly worked with multiple teams across the company to deliver new platform features as new products were released.

experience.title: White Lion Interactive
experience.description: My role at White Lion was an all-around developer.  I worked primarily on the backend of multiple sites, whos lifespan was as high as 10 years.  Laravel and Kohana (in various forms) were the primary frameworks we worked in.  I was able to implement more modern techniques and frameworks like Angular and React into projects that would benifit from them.

experience.title: Redhead Labs, LLC
experience.description: Redhead Labs is primarily an agency built around providing customers with custom e-commerce solutions built on the BigCommerce platform.  I worked as a full-stack developer providing start-to-finish development of projects including implementing custom BigCommerce plugins.

experience.title: HAUS
experience.description: While working at HAUS, I picked up python and django development.  I worked initially as the lead developer on the Toyota Owners' site, but always had other ongoing projects to manage as well. I also served as a primary DevOps engineer as we transitioned into a Heroku based development workflow.

experience.title: GROW Interactive
experience.description: Grow was the first agency I worked for, and we went from the owner's house to a multi-million dollar renovated office in Downtown Norfolk VA, serving clients like Google and FedEX, through agencies like Saatchi and Saatchi and Goodby, Silverstein & Partners. I was the primary Backend Developer, Lead Developer and unofficial DevOps engineer. I worked in basically everyting but flash.
